review_title: Best Company I've Ever Worked For
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Santa Clarita, CA

review_title: I would recommend for services and employment.
job_title: Program Manager in Santa Clarita, CA

review_title: If you want to grow,  join Child and Family Center.
job_title: AMFT, Clinician-I Alternatives in Santa Clarita, CA
pros: Child and Family Center is a very well organized facility. Staff members are very supportive and compassionate. Supervisors, HR department, IT department and even maintenance crew, all are very hard working. Front office staff also works very efficiently. I also like the fact of having s security guard during working hours to maintain safety not only for clients but also for staff members. Monthly ongoing trainings also keeps our knowledge current.
cons: If I come across any cons about this place, I will update my feedback.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Santa Clarita, CA
pros: This place cares about the well-being of their employees. It is a pleasant place to work that truly believes in showing the same care to their employees as they offer to their clients. The onboarding process is well organized and very helpful in acclimating a new employee to the environment.  They also believe in promoting within,
cons: I only wish they could train more companies to operate as well they do, creating an environment where the employees are happy to be there. I believe a person should not only enjoy the work they do, but they should also enjoy where they do it.

job_title: Front Office Specialist in Santa Clarita, CA
pros: Great environment, The mission for the agency is truly to help the community which is great. The boss’s have a open door policy and extremely flexible with your schedules. The team I worked with were supportive and always there if you needed their assistance. Definitely a great place to work. Bitter sweet leaving this agency.

job_title: Out Patient Therapist in Santa Clarita, CA
pros: Nice offices and time off at Christmas.
cons: Company was disorganized.  Management had communication challenges and policy inconsistencies (ie; cut backs on benefits after promised).  Huge turn over!  Many many lay offs.  I heard that management made many changes and is better now.

job_title: Child Family Specialist in Santa Clarita, CA
cons: It does not pay as much as some of the other agencies. Also the agency does not provide bonuses are stipends for high billers.

review_title: Management doesn't know what they are doing
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Santa Clarita, CA
pros: Great co workers, lovely building to work at, the clients are wonderful to work it and really benefit from the therapy services.
cons: Management doesn't know what they are doing and keep making changes which is disruptive to staff.  Lots of policy changes which are confusing.  Staff keep leaving and people don't feel safe.

pros: Some good benefits choices, some good supervisors and clinical staff
cons: Poor morale, senior management fighting each other, high turnover rate

review_title: Very disappointing since the agency had so much potential.

cons: Lots of empty promises. Management has a pattern of telling hard workers the will be promoted to keep them sround. In the end the promote their favorites.

pros: Wonderful coworkers, generous holidays and vacations
